column1: fy-kihyun 159615536699 "2017-04-15 22:06:02 GMT" http://fy-kihyun.com/post/159615536699/idols-suggest-go-to-tracks-to-listen-to-during "MONSTA X  MONSTA X’s Kihyun shared
column2: “Playmode’s ‘On The Way To See You Off. (tentative title)’ When you listen to the song
column3: it feels like spring itself. Playmode is an artist who really helped me musically. Another song is ‘How About You
column4: ’ from our recent album. It was written by Wonho and is a good song that also has a spring vibe.”© Soompi " True text

column1: fy-kihyun 159390359039 "2017-04-09 22:14:01 GMT" http://fy-kihyun.com/post/159390359039/monsta-xs-kihyun-successfully-overcomes "MONSTA X’s Kihyun demonstrated his maturity as a singer by owning the stage with a song older than his age.  During the April 7 episode of “Singing Battle
column2: ” Kihyun appeared as a “hidden card” singer for Park Kyung Lim‘s team and faced off against comedian Kim Hak Do from Lee Sang Min’s team.  “The only thing I have is energy. I will perform with the energy I had back in my rookie days
column3: ” Kihyun declared.  The other guests on the show compared the ages of Kihyun and his opponent Kim Hak Do
column4: shocked by the fact that Kihyun was a 93-liner while Kim Hak Do had debuted in the year 1993. The panelists worried about whether Kihyun would be able to pull off Kim Hyun Sik’s “Love Love Love
column5: ” a song that had been released before he was even born.  Kihyun
column7: instantly turned their worries into awe. He effortlessly showcased his powerful vocals and made the audience forget about any generation gaps. In the end
column8: he won the battle by a landslide with a score of twelve to one. Check out his performance here!© Soompi" True text

fy-kihyun 152374728114 "2016-10-27 10:08:36 GMT" http://fy-kihyun.com/post/152374728114/kihyun-wonho-and-hyungwon-revealed-to-have "MONSTA X’s Wonho
column3: and Hyungwon were revealed to have been involved in a minor car accident.  On October 27
column4: a source spoke with Ilgan Sports and said
column7: and Hyungwon were involved in a minor collision while coming to Seoul from Busan last night around 11 p.m. Thankfully there were no serious injuries.”  A source from Starship Entertainship explained
column8: “The accident was a minor collision. The members were startled but thankfully there were no injuries. Although it was a minor collision we plan on going to the hospital right away to check for any side effects if they feel any pain.”  MONSTA X has left for Jeju Island for Mnet’s special Jeju episode. The members plan on receiving a complete medical examination if they are not feeling well after filming. The seven-member group is currently promoting their latest title track “Fighter.” © Soompi" True text

column1: fy-kihyun 151615118099 "2016-10-10 16:00:38 GMT" http://fy-kihyun.com/post/151615118099/mbc-allegedly-steals-monsta-xs-choreography "MBC’s 2016 DMC Festival was recently held this past weekend and by all accounts
column2: it was a spectacular event which included an all-star performance of Super Junior’s “Sorry Sorry” that featured Leeteuk
column6: allegations have arisen that the choreography for that “Sorry Sorry” performance may have been taken - without permission - from Monsta X.  Just recently
column7: Wonho revealed on the group’s V-app broadcast that the DMC Festival “Sorry
column8: Sorry” choreography was apparently taken from Monsta X without their permission. When the group asked MBC what had happened
column9: the network allegedly told them that the choreography was cool
column10: so it handed it off to the other groups to perform.For those who are unaware of what’s happening
column12: Monsta X performed a cover of “Sorry
column13: Sorry” at MBC’s Korea Music Wave event in Japan
column14: and it included some special choreography created by the group just for the song. However
column15: the group’s performance was cut due to “time constraints” and fancams were the only source of footage.Needless to say
column16: Monsta X fans - and K-pop fans in general - aren’t too happy about this and have taken to social media to voice their displeasure
column17: causing the hashtag #MONSTAXDESERVEBETTER to trend. At the time of writing
column18: MBC have yet to respond to all these allegations. Hopefully this situation will be resolved soon.© sbs " True text
